head.title: email : Webview : RPS Direct - Wednesday, April 15, 2020

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Wednesday, April 15, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, I was reviewing our food distribution data last night and realized that RPS has provided nearly 1/4 MILLION meals to our students since we closed. Just think about that for a second. It's staggering on two fronts: as a reminder of the severity of food insecurity in our community and as a symbol of how the RPS Family bands together to support one another. Please join me in thanking our nutrition workers, custodians, bus drivers, administrators, volunteers, and so many others for making our meal distribution program possible. Dr. Shadae Harris, our Chief Engagement Officer, has been leading this work in collaboration with Susan Roberson, our Director of Food and Nutrition. Enormous gratitude to them both! Today's updates: Access for MS Students to HS Modules on RPS@Home – I'm happy to report that middle school students who were enrolled in high school-credit courses when we closed now have access to the Edgenuity modules on RPS@Home. Thank you for your patience as Edgenuity worked this out! Computer Distribution – We'll be distributing computers and hot-spots to 9th-11th graders starting this Friday. Before getting to the details (below), I'd like to thank
meta.name: description

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Wednesday, April 15, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, I was reviewing our food distribution data last night and realized that RPS has provided nearly 1/4 MILLION meals to our students since we closed. Just think about that for a second. It's staggering on two fronts: as a reminder of the severity of food insecurity in our community and as a symbol of how the RPS Family bands together to support one another. Please join me in thanking our nutrition workers, custodians, bus drivers, administrators, volunteers, and so many others for making our meal distribution program possible. Dr. Shadae Harris, our Chief Engagement Officer, has been leading this work in collaboration with Susan Roberson, our Director of Food and Nutrition. Enormous gratitude to them both! Today's updates: Access for MS Students to HS Modules on RPS@Home – I'm happy to report that middle school students who were enrolled in high school-credit courses when we closed now have access to the Edgenuity modules on RPS@Home. Thank you for your patience as Edgenuity worked this out! Computer Distribution – We'll be distributing computers and hot-spots to 9th-11th graders starting this Friday. Before getting to the details (below), I'd like to thank

div.span: I was reviewing our food distribution data last night and realized that RPS has provided nearly 1/4 MILLION meals to our students since we closed. Just think about that for a second. It's staggering on two fronts: as a reminder of the severity of food insecurity in our community and as a symbol of how the RPS Family bands together to support one another.

Dr. Shadae Harris, our Chief Engagement Officer, has been leading this work in collaboration with Susan Roberson, our Director of Food and Nutrition. Enormous gratitude to them both!

strong.span: Access for MS Students to HS Modules on RPS@Home

div.span: – I'm happy to report that middle school students who were enrolled in high school-credit courses when we closed now have access to the Edgenuity modules on RPS@Home. Thank you for your patience as Edgenuity worked this out!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: – We'll be distributing computers and hot-spots to 9th-11th graders starting this Friday. Before getting to the details (below), I'd like to thank our ITRTs, other RPS staff, and volunteers from Richmond's Department of Parks and Recreation for helping make this possible! (In case you're wondering, those are hot-spots being set up in the pic below.)

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Any RPS 9th-11th grader who already signed up for a device using the online form AND any senior who signed up but was unable to come on Monday.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: If you have not signed up yet, you can do so here.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Armstrong HS (for 9th-11th graders from Armstrong and Franklin Military)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Huguenot HS (for 9th-11th graders from Huguenot only)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Marshall HS (for 9th-11th graders from Marshall, Community, TJ, Open, RAS, and RCEEA)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Wyth HS (for 9th-11th graders from Wythe only)

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 10th Graders: Tuesday, April 21

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 9:30 am (for last names starting with the letters A-D)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 10:15 am (for last names starting with the letters E-J)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 11:00 am (for last names starting with the letters K-R)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: 11:45 am (or last names starting with the letters S-Z)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Note: These time windows are intended to help with social distancing so we respectfully request that students do everything possible to adhere to them. That said, we will not turn away anyone who comes outside their designated time.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: We need a parent/caregiver to sign our standard user agreement, available in English and Spanish. If a parent/caregiver cannot come, a senior may come on their own as long as they bring a signed agreement with them. These forms are available on our website and at all of our food sites.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Your student ID# (which can be found on your report card and transcript)

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: A mask or face covering

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Each distribution site will have two pick-up options: in the building and curbside.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: The process of signing out a computer and/or hotspot will take about 15 minutes per student. Each device needs to be powered up and the student then needs to log in to make sure everything is working properly. Parents/caregivers may come without their student but they will need to be able to log on with their student's ID# and password. Given this, we strongly encourage students to come.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Everyone on the distribution team will be wearing masks and gloves, and will have disinfectant wipes for the devices and hand sanitizer for anyone who needs it.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: As always, if you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me at jkamras@rvaschools.net.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Please keep sending them to me at jkamras@rvaschools.net!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I want to take this opportunity to shout out the Bilingual parent Liaison at E.S.H Greene Elementary, Mr. Hernandez, for his outstanding support to the families in Southwood. With everything going on, Mr. Hernandez has gone above and beyond for families by finding resources to assist with rent, food, etc. Thank you for all your hard work and dedication. You are highly appreciated.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a shout out to Principal Gordon from Oak Grove-Bellemeade Elementary. He has been checking on the staff since we got out on March 13, via group text messages. This shows that he is concerned about the staff even as we are unable to come to work at this time.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a Shout Out to my son's principal, Mr. David Hudson, from Franklin Military Academy. He has been the best principal, keeping me updated on everything. I also want to give a Shout Out to Mr. Wester from Franklin Military Academy. They are the best!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to shout out Mrs. West, Ms. Smith, and Ms. Williams from JB Fisher. My daughter and son have really enjoyed the zoom calls from the teachers. Ms. Smith and Ms. Williams teach the kids from Monday-Friday. My son loves his teachers and is really excited about seeing his classmates and still being able to learn. Mrs. West has set up zoom calls each week and went out of the way to send each child in her class a special letter. I appreciate their hard work and dedication. Thank you, RPS!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I'd like to shout out all the amazing volunteers and partners at Swansboro Elementary. They are donating workbooks and other educational materials for our students, as well as finding creative and thoughtful ways to stay in touch with their mentees while school is out. Thank you for your continued dedication and love for our students! We are lucky to have you!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I wanted to shout out to Erin Stanley, the Director of Family Engagement for RPS. Erin has done an amazing job coordinating all of the volunteering for food distribution and meal delivery. She’s quick to respond and is always available to answer any and all questions. She makes sure that things get done efficiently and correctly. She is also very grateful and shows her appreciation often. Thank you, Erin, for all you do!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to shout out Ms. Marshall at Woodville Elementary School. She is wonderful! She still teaches through videos and also calls and checks up on her students. We really appreciate her!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: My Binford middle schooler really enjoyed connecting with Ms. Wilson over Zoom this morning. Ms. Wilson was her science teacher last year. We are so grateful to her for assisting the 7th grade science class she doesn’t even teach (they’ve had a long-term sub for most of the year). My 4th grader at Holton loves her weekly SPACE meetings with Ms. Sims.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I wanted to send a note of my gratitude to everyone who was involved in getting RPS@Home launched. As an educator, I have to say that I have been completed bowled over by the content and delivery RPS@Home has provided for my kindergartner. For the first few weeks, I was struggling to pull together lesson plans on my own (...what a horrible idea!). I was worried about moving to online activities, but it has been such a success that I would be remiss if I didn't shout out the kindergarten team that was involved in putting together the materials for these first two weeks. My daughter and I both love the lessons, and I love that I'm not alone in trying to find the right curriculum and activities. Thank you for your investment in our kids in this manner!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to shout out an unseen hero, Mr. Jeff Rew, Albert Hill ITRT. He is the machine behind Albert Hill's social media pages and is always responsive to parent, student, and staff needs with technology. Mr. Rew goes above and beyond by calling parents to walk them through tech issues. He responds quickly to emails and direct messages. He makes directional and informational posts to Albert Hill's social media pages to help families and staff navigate Google Classroom, RPS@Home, YouTube, and all things technology. The Hill Family loves you, Jeff, and appreciates all that you do. Every Tiger! Every Day!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Shout Out to Mrs. Majer for her willingness and dedication to her 2nd grade classroom at J.B. Cary. She established a Zoom book reading every Tuesday and Thursday at 2:30 pm. Mrs. Majer has been reading two to three books in each session. Mrs. Majer started reading the week after school closed. Reading makes a difference to the children by letting them know their teacher cares. Kudos for Mrs. Majer's dedication!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I want to send a huge "Shout-Out" to Mr. Eric Laroche, teacher at Aspire Academy, for picking up several laptops for seniors and dropping them off at their homes! Way to go, Eric! Thanks for always making sure our students have what they need to be successful!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to shout out Ms. Banton at John Marshall High School for checking in on my daughter to make sure she’s ok with her work and see if she needs help. She misses her and loves her. Ms. Banton is a loveable teacher and I just want to thank her for all she does!!!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I'd like to give a shout-out to Ashley Jackson Bland! Her leadership and organizational skills made Chromebook distribution to seniors at John Marshall yesterday practically flawless!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I want to give a big shout out to Mr. Simone. He teaches English at Richmond Community High School. Ever since the students have been out of school, Mr. Simone has stayed in contact with his students by conducting class periods via Zoom. At a time when students are experiencing uncertainty, Mr. Simone has continued to be the "normal" in their lives. He thinks nothing of facilitating RCHS's debate team or creating the school's website or to just making himself available if any student asks for help. Mr. Simone exemplifies what it truly means to go above and beyond as an RPS teacher.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Shout out to the staff at Chimborazo Elementary! They have been great. And thanks to Mr. Oristein for going that extra mile!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Thank you, Ms. Johnson (TJ School Counselor), for answering my call over the weekend to support me with enrolling my son onto the RPS@Home Portal!!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Mrs. Erin Campbell at Chimborazo is the best. She keeps in touch and keeps information updated on the Dojo app. My son and I truly miss her!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a shout out to Stephanie Purcell for making sure the Barack Obama Elementary SAF report was submitted for the month of March.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a shout out to Ms. Bauman, our son’s 5th grade teacher at Linwood Holton. She has approached this time with so much compassion and empathy. She is readily available to answer questions, offer advice, and just give moral support—and she starts every video and Zoom lesson by letting the kids know that she misses them. We couldn't get through this without her. She’s wonderful, and we are so, so grateful.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)

span.span: – Today's final Wishtree celebrity reader is the First Lady of Virginia, Pamela Northam! Thank you so much, Mrs. Northam, for taking the time to do this! And thank you for tireless advocacy on behalf of the Commonwealth's children. We're so grateful to have you pushing for greater investment in our public schools, particularly in the area of early childhood education.

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)

span.span: To see all the other celebrity readers, just click here!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

a.style: font-weight: normal;font-weight: normal;color: #333;text-decoration: underline;color: #333;text-decoration: underline

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
span.span: "Mr. K's 30 Minutes of Math!" – Check out my math lessons at 2 pm every weekdays. I'm focusing on fractions, but every lesson also includes a Math Joke of the Day and a Math Riddle of the Day. You can also view past episodes here!
